Its capital is the city of Ovalle. It is named after the main river of the province: the Limarí River. ==Geography== The Limarí province has an area of , the second largest province in the Coquimbo region. Limarí is bordered on the north by the Elqui province, on the east by Argentina, on the south by the Choapa province and on the west by the Pacific Ocean. The main river of the province is the Limarí river that is long. ==Population== (last national census), there were 156,158 people living in the province, giving it a population density of inhabitants/km². The largest city of the province is Ovalle, its capital, with a population, in 2002, of 66,405 inhabitants. ==Administration== As a province, Limarí is a second-level administrative division, consisting of five communes (comunas). The city of Ovalle serves as the provincial capital. The province is administered by a governor.
